Doomed.name: Doomed
Doomed.description: You’re in grave danger—mark 1-fatigue every few seconds (or each exchange) until you free yourself.

Impaired.name: Impaired
Impaired.description: You’re slowed or off-balance—mark 1-fatigue or take a -2 to all physical actions (PCs) / choose one fewer technique (NPCs)

Trapped.name: Trapped
Trapped.description: You’re completely helpless—you must mark a combination of three conditions or fatigue to escape.

Stunned.name: Stunned
Stunned.description: You’re caught off-guard—you can’t act or respond for a few seconds until you steady yourself

Empowered.name: Empowered
Empowered.description: Your abilities are naturally stronger in this moment—clear 1-fatigue at the end of each exchange.

Favored.name: Favored
Favored.description: You’re buoyed by circumstance—choose an additional basic or mastered technique in the next exchange, even on a miss.

Inspired.name: Inspired
Inspired.description: You’re ready to stand for something—clear Inspired to shift your balance toward a principle of your choice.

Prepared.name: Prepared
Prepared.description: You’re ready for what’s coming—clear Prepared to take +1 to an appropriate roll (after the roll) or avoid marking a condition.

Afraid.name: Afraid
Afraid.effect: -2 to intimidate and call someone out.

Angry.name: Angry
Angry.effect: -2 to guide and comfort and assess a situation.
Angry.clearing_condition: Break something important or lash out at a friend.

Guilty.name: Guilty
Guilty.effect: -2 to push your luck and +2 to deny a callout.
Guilty.clearing_condition: Make a personal sacrifice to absolve your guilt

Insecure.name: Insecure
Insecure.effect: -2 to trick and resist shifting your balance.
Insecure.clearing_condition: Take foolhardy action without talking to your companions.

Troubled.name: Troubled
Troubled.effect: -2 to plead and rely on your skills or training.
Troubled.clearing_condition: Seek guidance from a mentor or powerful figure.

Frustrated.name: Frustrated
Frustrated.effect: -2 to push your luck and +1 to intimidate.
Frustrated.clearing_condition: Lash out at someone or act decisively without consulting anyone.

Jaded.name: Jaded
Jaded.clearing_condition: Give in or give up in the face of meaningful opposition.

Remorseful.name: Remorseful
Remorseful.effect: -2 to the stance move and +1 to call someone out.
Remorseful.clearing_condition: Attempt to make genuine amends for past wrongs.

Shaken.name: Shaken
Shaken.effect: -2 to guide and comfort and +1 to assess a situation
Shaken.clearing_condition: Seek guidance from an old friend or mentor.

Worried.name: Worried
Worried.effect: -2 to deny a callout and +1 to rely on skills or training
Worried.clearing_condition: Take control in a situation in which another should lead.

The Adamant.name: The Adamant
The Adamant.description:
Pragmatic, fervent, dangerous, self-sacrificing. The Adamant is deeply committed to a cause, to the point that they may break all the rules to achieve their end. Sometimes, they might even go a bit too far in their drive—they have no hesitation to push and push and push when it comes to the causes they think are just. That’s why the Adamant needs a lodestar, the one person they listen to who can rein them in, let them know that maybe they should cool it and hold off a bit.
The Adamant can sometimes be dismissive of others, especially if those others stand in the way of the Adamant’s goals… but they’re also aware of their tendency to go too far, and to make sure they listen to the right voices telling them to hold back. The distinction between heroism and villainy can be a fine line for the Adamant, with their focus on results over means. They want to stay on the right side of that line, and they need their friends to find the right path forward.
